title: Digital Access & App Security

sections.title: Logging In Safely
sections.content:
To see your money, you must 'authenticate' (prove who you are). 

- **Credentials**: Your username and password.
- **Biometrics**: Using your fingerprint or face to log in quickly.
- **MFA / 2FA**: A second security step, like a code sent to your phone.
- **Log in / Sign in**: Entering the app.
- **Log out / Sign out**: Leaving the app safely.

sections.title: Secure Login Flow
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Open App] --> B[Enter Username]
    B --> C[Biometrics/Password]
    C --> D{MFA Check?}
    D -- Yes --> E[Enter SMS Code]
    D -- No --> F[Dashboard]
    E --> F
```

sections.title: The App Dashboard
sections.content:
The 'Dashboard' is the main screen of your app.

- **Menu**: The list of options (usually at the top or bottom).
- **Profile**: Your personal settings and photo.
- **Notifications**: Alerts about your money.
- **Search Bar**: A place to find transactions by name.

sections.title: Grammar: Prepositions in Digital Banking
sections.content:
We use **In**, **On**, and **At** to describe where things are in the digital world.

- **In**: Use for the app or folders.
  - *Your balance is **in** the app.*
  - *Look **in** the 'Settings' folder.*
- **On**: Use for the screen, page, or buttons.
  - *The transfer button is **on** the screen.*
  - *Click **on** the 'Confirm' button.*
- **At**: Use for specific locations or points.
  - *I am **at** the login page.*
  - *The total is **at** the top of the screen.*

objectives: Identify different methods of secure authentication
Navigate the main dashboard of a banking app
Use prepositions (in, on, at) correctly in digital contexts
